title: Shaw heads to Dubai after hamstring injury setback with Matic joining for warm weather training
text:
Luke Shaw is heading to Dubai to step up his rehabilitation from injury following a setback in his recovery.

The Manchester United left back has been out since August with a hamstring injury in his right leg and was initially expected to be out for six weeks.

He returned to light training as part of his recovery programme but suffered a setback and is expected in Dubai this week to see if he responds better under warm weather training conditions.

Luke Shaw is going to Dubai for warm weather training to aid his recovery from injury in August

Shaw, who has been out since United's defeat by Crystal Palace on August 24, is heading for the Transform Altitude Performance Center in Dubai which is fast becoming the go-to place for Premier League players.

The 24-year-old's injured team-mate Nemanja Matic is also due in Dubai on Tuesday having seen Paul Pogba take advantage of the facilities there last week.

Matic and Shaw are expected back at United at the weekend.

Manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has seen his threadbare squad stretched to the limits with a number of injuries this season which has hindered United's progress.

Nemanja Matic has also had some injury problems and will be joining Shaw in Dubai

'Luke is not too long [away],' said Solskjaer. 'So, it's looking brighter and that's a big plus.' However, on Matic he added: 'He's played on with a little problem and we decided he couldn't play on any more with that. So I don't know how long he'll be out.'

Concerns have been raised among staff by the number of soft tissue injuries suffered by United players this season and Solskjaer last week pointed out that Liverpool went through a similar phase four years ago when Jurgen Klopp attempted to transform their intensity levels in training.

Solskjaer has been eager to upgrade his squad's fitness after studying their drop in performance levels towards the end of the last campaign and is recruiting physio Tim Williamson from Celtic.

United face FK Partizan in the Europa League on Thursday with Axel Tuanzebe a doubt after being ruled out of Sunday's game against Liverpool with a hip injury prior to kick-off.

Paul Pogba was back at Old Trafford on Sunday but is still wearing a protective boot on his right foot. He is due for further scans on Monday to assess his progress.

'We're going to have a test on Pogba tomorrow and see where he's at and how long it'll be until he's back,' Solskjaer said.
